content.description: Clark drives through two traffic lights on his way to work each day. From experience, he estimates that the probability that the first light will be red when he reaches it is <math alttext="0.3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. He also estimates that the probability that the second light will be red when he reaches it is <math alttext="0.45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.45</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The lights are far enough apart that they can be considered to operate independently of each other.
